chargeHist.descr: Battery to School District Officers, etc

result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron D Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *Pay costs of supervision, court costs and surcharges by end of probationary period.  If not paid, will result in civil judgment.

*Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
*Attend an AODA treatment program as determined by the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron D Thompson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aaron D Thompson in court with Attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  STATE IN COMPLIANCE WITH VICTIM NOTIFICATION.   

AS TO COUNT #1:  THE COURT ORDERED:  The defendant to serve SIX (6) months in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE STRAIGHT TIME with ONE (1) DAY credit.  THE COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on ONE (1) YEAR PROBATION with supervision by Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Perform 25 hours of Community Service;
* Pay costs of supervision, court costs and surcharges by end of probationary period.  If not paid, will result in civil judgment;
* Absolute soberity, random urine screens, possess no illegal drugs.
* Attend an AODA treatment program as determined by the agent.
* Obtain and maintain suitable employment or schooling for at least 40 hours a week.

Appeal rights given.  

FILED, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Plea date scheduled for 10-01-2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Aaron D Thompson in court with Attorney Steven Sargent, appearing for Attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State files Information with the court.
Arraignment held.  Defense counsel waived reading of the Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.
Court orders case adjourned for plea hearing in Branch 30.
Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated September 9, 2015 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Aaron D Thompson in court with attorney Edgar Lin for Louis Edward Epps.  Antonella Aleman for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Conen, Branch 30. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 30.  Arraignment scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Stephen Leisher.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Aaron D Thompson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Aaron D Thompson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Conen, Branch 30.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   
Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Aaron D Thompson not in court.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6/19/15 @ 1:30 pm
